questions.question: Describe the anatomical structure and function of the synovial joints, including the different types and their specific characteristics.
expected_key_points: Six main characteristics: joint cavity, articular cartilage, synovial membrane, synovial fluid, fibrous capsule, ligaments
Types: plane, hinge, pivot, condyloid, saddle, ball-and-socket
questions.hint: Focus on the structural components and how they relate to function.

questions.question: Explain the blood supply and innervation of the heart, including the coronary arteries and conducting system.
expected_key_points: Main branches: anterior interventricular, circumflex, marginal
SA node, AV node, bundle of His, Purkinje fibers
questions.hint: Consider both arterial supply and venous drainage, plus neural control.

questions.question: Describe the histological layers of the gastrointestinal tract and their specialized adaptations in different regions.
expected_key_points: Four main layers: mucosa, submucosa, muscularis externa, serosa/adventitia
Mucosal components: epithelium, lamina propria, muscularis mucosae
Specializations: gastric pits, intestinal villi, Brunner's glands
Regional differences: esophagus vs stomach vs small intestine vs large intestine
questions.hint: Compare and contrast different regions of the GI tract.
